title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.001
frontText: True/False: Elastic Beanstalk directs incoming network traffic between EC2 instances at any scale.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.002
frontText: An ________ is made up of one or more geographically neighboring data centers within a single AWS region.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.003
frontText: The ________ precisely defines the extent of your responsibility for ensuring the safety and continued operation of your AWS resources.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.004
frontText: Which tool should you install locally to manage your AWS resources at the command line‐level?

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.005
frontText: What does an AWS service level agreement (SLA) value of 99.99 percent actually mean about the availability of that service?
backText: That AWS guarantees any resource running in that service will be available 99.99 percent of the time—meaning service will be unavailable for less than five minutes each month. AWS will provide service credits when that target isn’t met.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.006
frontText: The ________ support plan from AWS provides limited general guidance and system‐impaired response to a single user.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.007
frontText: True/False: AWS describes the software operating system images used to power EC2 instances as Amazon Machine Images (AMIs).

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.008
frontText: The AWS ________ provides many vendor‐supported, production‐ready Amazon Machine Images for use with EC2 instances.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.009
frontText: True/False: You can change the instance type used by a running EC2 instance without any service interruption.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.010
frontText: ________ is the designation of a low‐cost general‐purpose EC2 instance type.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.011
frontText: True/False: D2 is the designation of a storage‐optimized EC2 instance type.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.012
frontText: What is the EC2 instance tenancy model that provides the highest level of security and isolation?

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.013
frontText: Which is the most cost‐effective EC2 instance pricing model for a 24/7 workload that will run for six months?

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.014
frontText: Which is the most cost‐effective EC2 instance pricing model for workloads that can tolerate unexpected disruptions?

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.015
frontText: Unless you’re using an ________, stopping and restarting an EC2 instance might result in the instance’s public IP address being released.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.016
frontText: True/False: Most AWS service limits can be increased by submitting a request to AWS support.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.017
frontText: Which Elastic Block Store (EBS) volume type can deliver the highest IOPS performance?

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.018
frontText: The ________ Elastic Block Store (EBS) volume type is the best choice for larger data volumes requiring only infrequent access.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.019
frontText: True/False: Instance Store volumes retain their data when the associated EC2 instance is shut down.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.020
frontText: An EC2 security group acts like a firewall to protect resources at the ________ level.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.021
frontText: True/False: Names given to S3 buckets need to be unique only across your account.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.022
frontText: To improve the success rates for uploads to S3 buckets that are larger than 100 MB, AWS recommends you use which feature?

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.023
frontText: ________ protects data at rest within S3 buckets.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.024
frontText: True/False: Logging of all S3 bucket activity is enabled by default.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.025
frontText: Which of the S3 Standard‐IA and S3 One Zone‐IA storage levels is more fault tolerant?

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.026
frontText: True/False: By default, when an object within an S3 bucket is overwritten, S3 uses versioning to create a copy of the overwritten version.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.027
frontText: What is the preferred tool for controlling access to objects in S3 buckets?

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.028
frontText: You can provide users with temporary web access to an S3‐hosted object using ________.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.029
frontText: Amazon Glacier provides inexpensive object storage, but what’s the feature trade‐off?

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.030
frontText: A ________ is a logical segment within a VPC that’s assigned a block of private IP addresses given to your EC2 instances.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.031
frontText: True/False: Default VPC subnets are not able to handle IPv6 CIDR blocks.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.032
frontText: EC2 instances communicate with network resources via one or more ________.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.033
frontText: EC2 instances connect to the Internet (via their elastic network interfaces) through an ________.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.034
frontText: What is the function of a route table within a VPC?
backText: To facilitate network connectivity between subnets and devices using selected CIDR addresses

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.035
frontText: How would you specify a source address for a security group rule to permit inbound traffic from any external IPv4 address?

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.036
frontText: Unlike a security group that’s associated with an instance, a network access control list (NACL) is attached to a ________.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.037
frontText: True/False: An EC2 instance that has no public IP address can, nevertheless, be accessed from the Internet through a properly configured security group rule.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.038
frontText: What is the key difference between a NAT gateway and a NAT instance?
backText: A NAT gateway is managed (and automatically scaled when necessary) by AWS, whereas a NAT instance is a normal EC2 instance you launch using an AWS AMI.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.039
frontText: VPC ________ is a tool for connecting resources living in VPCs in multiple regions to each other.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.040
frontText: Amazon ________ is a MySQL‐compatible, cloud‐optimized relational database engine available for AWS RDS.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.041
frontText: What is the size (i.e., page size) of a single I/O operation on a MySQL or MariaDB database?

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.042
frontText: True/False: A general‐purpose SSD (gp2) storage volume is sufficient for most database deployments.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.043
frontText: True/False: Magnetic storage for RDS database instances is limited to a maximum size of 4 TB and 1,000 IOPS.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.044
frontText: Improving performance for RDS operations by scaling horizontally through the use of redundant read‐only instances is possible with ________.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.045
frontText: You can protect RDS database availability from outages by creating full standby instances in a second availability zone using ________.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.046
frontText: To avoid system disruption, backing up an RDS database instance can be scheduled to execute at some point during any ________‐minute window.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.047
frontText: True/False: AWS takes full responsibility for OS and security patches for RDS instances.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.048
frontText: A Redshift cluster using fast SSD volumes for dense storage can store up to ________ of data.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.049
frontText: Which of relational and nonrelational database types is considered schemaless?

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.050
frontText: When working with DynamoDB, a ________ is a primary key that contains a single value.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.051
frontText: When designing a DynamoDB database, you want to avoid “hot partitions” where too much read/write activity is directed against a single partition item. What is the best way to do that?

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.052
frontText: What is the largest item size that a DynamoDB database can store?

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.053
frontText: How many write capacity units (WCUs) would you need to write 50 items/second to a DynamoDB database where each item is 3 KB in size?

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.054
frontText: When using DynamoDB, ________ let you look up data by an attribute other than the table’s primary key.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.055
frontText: An ________ is a document that identifies one or more actions as they relate to controlling access to one or more AWS resources.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.056
frontText: True/False: AWS IAM policies are formatted using JSON.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.057
frontText: Which AWS user should not normally be used for day‐to‐day administration operations?

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.058
frontText: Why, when rotating the AWS security keys used by your applications, is it a good idea to initially deactivate old keys rather than deleting them?
backText: To ensure your applications were all properly updated

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.059
frontText: What is the most efficient way to organize an account’s multiple IAM users to minimize administration overhead?

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.060
frontText: An IAM ________ is a temporary identity that a user or service seeking access to your account resources can request.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.061
frontText: The Amazon ________ service can manage user sign‐up and sign‐in to your applications and assign temporary controlled access to resources on your AWS account.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.062
frontText: True/False: You need to manually provision and deploy AWS Managed Microsoft AD to control the way Microsoft SharePoint, .NET, and SQL Server–based workloads running in your VPC connect to your AWS resources.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.063
frontText: Which AWS service can you use to avoid having to hard‐code access secrets into your application code?

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.064
frontText: Within the context of AWS CloudTrail, an ________ is a record of an action that a principal performs against an AWS resource.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.065
frontText: True/False: CloudTrail logs only API actions.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.066
frontText: By default, CloudTrail logs ________ days of management events and stores them in the event history.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.067
frontText: The log entry within a CloudTrail log file that contains the global endpoint of the service against which the action was taken is called the ________.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.068
frontText: True/False: You can use CloudTrail to log account events from all regions.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.069
frontText: How does the CloudTrail log file integrity feature ensure that your logs haven’t been deleted or modified without authorization?

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.070
frontText: True/False: Most AWS services will, by default, send detailed monitoring metrics to CloudWatch every minute (although CloudWatch might publish only five‐minute averages).

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.071
frontText: For how long will CloudWatch retain monitoring datapoints at their lowest resolution (i.e., one‐hour resolution)?

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.072
frontText: To create a graph from a CloudWatch metric, you must specify the metric, the statistic, and the ________.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.073
frontText: True/False: The CloudWatch Logs feature permits you to collect and manage logs from non‐AWS sources.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.074
frontText: You would install a ________ on an EC2 instance to permit CloudWatch to collect system and application performance metrics.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.075
frontText: What are the three possible states of a CloudWatch alarm?

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.076
frontText: The Simple Notification Service (SNS) uses communication channels called ________.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.077
frontText: Which AWS service can help you visualize all the resources currently deployed in your account, their event histories, and how their configurations have changed over time?

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.078
frontText: True/False: AWS Config configuration snapshots are saved to S3 buckets.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.079
frontText: In the world of DNS, what role do nameservers play?
backText: Associating a domain name with its IP address

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.080
frontText: A DNS record used to define one hostname as an alias for another is called a ________.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.081
frontText: A DNS record used to map a hostname to an IPv6 address is called an ________.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.082
frontText: How does Route 53 monitor the health of a web resource?
backText: By trying to load a preset HTML or PHP file on the web server

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.083
frontText: True/False: Weighted routing sends incoming resource requests to the instance that will provide the lowest latency for each client.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.084
frontText: True/False: Latency routing routes traffic according to the origin country or state of the request.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.085
frontText: Amazon ________ is a service designed to lower the time it takes your content to reach your users.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.086
frontText: True/False: EC2 instances and S3 buckets are the only origins you can use for CloudFront distributions.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.087
frontText: EC2 Auto Scaling will launch new instances built from a ________ to meet rising demand for your application.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.088
frontText: The three values you use to define the behavior of an Auto Scaling group are the minimum and maximum number of instances you want running and the ________.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.089
frontText: Simple scaling policies (of EC2 Auto Scaling) will increase the number of running instances in line with the adjustment type you select. What are the three kinds of adjustment types?

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.090
frontText: The best protection against a regionwide service failure of S3 infrastructure is ________.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.091
frontText: True/False: Elastic File System deployments can be accessed only from EC2 instances.
backText: False—on‐premises servers can also be included.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.092
frontText: True/False: The Amazon Aurora database engine running within RDS can, for redundancy, be provisioned with up to 15 replicas.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.093
frontText: True/False: Using a VPN connection over the Internet between your on‐premises resources and your AWS VPC will improve your connection speeds.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.094
frontText: What is the EC2 instance type parameter that describes an instance’s compute power?

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.095
frontText: What is the EC2 instance type parameter that describes the number of virtual CPUs allotted to an instance?

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.096
frontText: What S3‐based feature can, for a small premium cost, speed up large data transfers between your on‐premises location and your S3 buckets?

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.097
frontText: True/False: The AWS application load balancer operates at Layer 4 (TCP) of the OSI model.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.098
frontText: The AWS service that provides Git‐like code repository features is called ________.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.099
frontText: You can use ________ to orchestrate all the stages of an AWS‐based CI/CD process.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.100
frontText: What is the best tool for visualizing monitoring metrics for multiple running AWS resources?

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.101
frontText: True/False: AWS Amplify is used with Amazon Chime to permit multi‐user video collaboration.
backText: False. Amplify is a platform where developers and admins can deploy their applications.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.102
frontText: ________ is a service that allows developers to store and share serverless applications.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.103
frontText: ________ can be used to provide pre‐approved AWS service configurations and resources to an organization’s developers.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.104
frontText: Which tool allows you to publish the data generated by your AWS resources so it can be consumed by remote applications?

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.105
frontText: Which service lets you test your mobile applications on virtual instances of actual devices?

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.106
frontText: ________ is a low‐code application development platform.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.107
frontText: True/False: The AWS Outposts service will install physical AWS servers in your data center to allow you integrated hybrid AWS/on‐premises resource consumption.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.108
frontText: True/False: Amazon Pinpoint lets you schedule compute‐intensive jobs on EC2 or RDS.
backText: False. Pinpoint lets you automate your inbound and outbound interactions with any number of marketing contacts.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.109
frontText: ________ allows you to use the SFTP, FTPS, or FTP protocols to manage file transfers between AWS and outside data providers or consumers.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.110
frontText: AppSync allows you to build ________ to securely connect frontend services with AWS data resources residing in multiple services and formats.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.111
frontText: What is the purpose of AWS Batch?
backText: It lets you automate the periodic execution of all the steps necessary for compute‐intensive operations whenever triggered by new data inputs.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.112
frontText: True/False: You can use AWS X‐Ray to track S3 lifecycle events operations.
backText: False. As of this writing, X‐Ray will only track the EC2, ECS, Lambda, SQS, SNS, and Elastic Beanstalk services.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.113
frontText: ________ uses machine learning to deliver search functionality for users of your websites and other hosted content.

title: 982623AWSCML.fc1.114
frontText: Which AWS search service is based on the open source Elasticsearch project?
